title: The Walking Dead crew are 'freaking out about season 10 storylines'
text:
Norman Reedus has got us all fired up (Picture: AMC)

The Walking Dead star Norman Reedus has revealed that the show’s crew are ‘freaking out’ over ‘crazy’ season 10 storylines.

The actor, who plays Daryl Dixon in the AMC zombie drama, has promised ‘mind-blowing’ content is on the way despite ratings dropping yet again to another series low.

Speaking at the ACE Comic Con Midwest, Norman teased: ‘I hope you’re excited for The Walking Dead because this season’s fricking crazy. It’s so good this season.

‘There are things that are gonna happen this season that are mind-blowing, and the sets are huge, it’s just nuts.

‘Everybody on our crew, who have been there for 10 years, are freaking out over this season. And they’re kinda hard to phase, ‘cause they’re there every single day, but it’s nuts.’

Gamma was recently introduced (Picture: AMC)

Asked to describe the dramatic upcoming episodes in one word, Norman continued: ‘Combustible. How’s that work?

‘The whole thing is flammable. Just wait. It gets really crazy.’

We’re keeping our fingers crossed that The Walking Dead will go above and beyond and deliver Norman’s vows.

Norman’s comments come just days after Deadline reported that the second chapter of season 10 broke AMC’s own record for the lowest-rated episode of the series.

The episode titled We Are The End Of The World fetched 3.47 million viewers, down from the opening installment which saw 4 million people tune in.

Despite the floundering figures, audiences were introduced to power-mad newbie Gamma and we were left asking some serious questions, including whether Gamma has plans to usurp Alpha as the head of The Whisperers.

The episode also evealed the origins of The Whisperers, particularly Alpha and how she ended up meeting Beta.

The Walking Dead airs Sundays at 9pm on AMC in the US and Mondays at 9pm on Fox in the UK.
